verses.text_plain: Then said Solomon, The Lord hath said that he would dwell in the thick darkness.
verses.verse_html: 1Then said Solomon, The Lord hath said that he would dwell in the thick darkness.

verses.text_plain: But I have built an house of habitation for thee, and a place for thy dwelling for ever.
verses.verse_html: 2But I have built an house of habitation for thee, and a place for thy dwelling for ever.

verses.text_plain: And the king turned his face, and blessed the whole congregation of Israel: and all the congregation of Israel stood.
verses.verse_html: 3And the king turned his face, and blessed the whole congregation of Israel: and all the congregation of Israel stood.

verses.text_plain: And he said, Blessed be the Lord God of Israel, who hath with his hands fulfilled that which he spake with his mouth to my father David, saying,
verses.verse_html: 4And he said, Blessed be the Lord God of Israel, who hath with his hands fulfilled that which he spake with his mouth to my father David, saying,

verses.text_plain: Since the day that I brought forth my people out of the land of Egypt I chose no city among all the tribes of Israel to build an house in, that my name might be there; neither chose I any man to be a ruler over my people Israel:
verses.verse_html: 5Since the day that I brought forth my people out of the land of Egypt I chose no city among all the tribes of Israel to build an house in, that my name might be there; neither chose I any man to be a ruler over my people Israel:

verses.text_plain: But I have chosen Jerusalem, that my name might be there; and have chosen David to be over my people Israel.
verses.verse_html: 6But I have chosen Jerusalem, that my name might be there; and have chosen David to be over my people Israel.

tokens.text: might be there; and have chosen

verses.text_plain: Now it was in the heart of David my father to build an house for the name of the Lord God of Israel.
verses.verse_html: 7Now it was in the heart of David my father to build an house for the name of the Lord God of Israel.

tokens.text: Now it was in the heart

verses.text_plain: But the Lord said to David my father, Forasmuch as it was in thine heart to build an house for my name, thou didst well in that it was in thine heart:
verses.verse_html: 8But the Lord said to David my father, Forasmuch as it was in thine heart to build an house for my name, thou didst well in that it was in thine heart:

tokens.text: Forasmuch as it was in thine heart
in that it was in thine heart

verses.text_plain: Notwithstanding thou shalt not build the house; but thy son which shall come forth out of thy loins, he shall build the house for my name.
verses.verse_html: 9Notwithstanding thou shalt not build the house; but thy son which shall come forth out of thy loins, he shall build the house for my name.

verses.text_plain: The Lord therefore hath performed his word that he hath spoken: for I am risen up in the room of David my father, and am set on the throne of Israel, as the Lord promised, and have built the house for the name of the Lord God of Israel.
verses.verse_html: 10The Lord therefore hath performed his word that he hath spoken: for I am risen up in the room of David my father, and am set on the throne of Israel, as the Lord promised, and have built the house for the name of the Lord God of Israel.

verses.text_plain: And in it have I put the ark, wherein is the covenant of the Lord, that he made with the children of Israel.
verses.verse_html: 11And in it have I put the ark, wherein is the covenant of the Lord, that he made with the children of Israel.

verses.text_plain: And he stood before the altar of the Lord in the presence of all the congregation of Israel, and spread forth his hands:
verses.verse_html: 12And he stood before the altar of the Lord in the presence of all the congregation of Israel, and spread forth his hands:

tokens.text: in the presence of all the congregation

verses.text_plain: For Solomon had made a brasen scaffold, of five cubits long, and five cubits broad, and three cubits high, and had set it in the midst of the court: and upon it he stood, and kneeled down upon his knees before all the congregation of Israel, and spread forth his hands toward heaven,
verses.verse_html:
13For Solomon had made a brasen scaffold, of five cubits long, and five cubits broad, and three cubits high, and had set it in the midst of the court: and upon it he stood, and kneeled down upon his knees before all the congregation of Israel, and spread forth his hands toward heaven,
 long: Heb. the length thereof, etc

footnotes.body_text: long: Heb. the length thereof, etc
footnotes.body_html: long: Heb. the length thereof, etc

verses.text_plain: And said, O Lord God of Israel, there is no God like thee in the heaven, nor in the earth; which keepest covenant, and shewest mercy unto thy servants, that walk before thee with all their hearts:
verses.verse_html: 14And said, O Lord God of Israel, there is no God like thee in the heaven, nor in the earth; which keepest covenant, and shewest mercy unto thy servants, that walk before thee with all their hearts:

verses.text_plain: Thou which hast kept with thy servant David my father that which thou hast promised him; and spakest with thy mouth, and hast fulfilled it with thine hand, as it is this day.
verses.verse_html: 15Thou which hast kept with thy servant David my father that which thou hast promised him; and spakest with thy mouth, and hast fulfilled it with thine hand, as it is this day.

verses.text_plain: Now therefore, O Lord God of Israel, keep with thy servant David my father that which thou hast promised him, saying, There shall not fail thee a man in my sight to sit upon the throne of Israel; yet so that thy children take heed to their way to walk in my law, as thou hast walked before me.
verses.verse_html:
16Now therefore, O Lord God of Israel, keep with thy servant David my father that which thou hast promised him, saying, There shall not fail thee a man in my sight to sit upon the throne of Israel; yet so that thy children take heed to their way to walk in my law, as thou hast walked before me.
 There: Heb. There shall not a man be cut off

footnotes.body_text: There: Heb. There shall not a man be cut off
footnotes.body_html: There: Heb. There shall not a man be cut off

verses.text_plain: Now then, O Lord God of Israel, let thy word be verified, which thou hast spoken unto thy servant David.
verses.verse_html: 17Now then, O Lord God of Israel, let thy word be verified, which thou hast spoken unto thy servant David.

verses.text_plain: But will God in very deed dwell with men on the earth? behold, heaven and the heaven of heavens cannot contain thee; how much less this house which I have built!
verses.verse_html: 18But will God in very deed dwell with men on the earth? behold, heaven and the heaven of heavens cannot contain thee; how much less this house which I have built!

tokens.text: thee; how much less this house

verses.text_plain: Have respect therefore to the prayer of thy servant, and to his supplication, O Lord my God, to hearken unto the cry and the prayer which thy servant prayeth before thee:
verses.verse_html: 19Have respect therefore to the prayer of thy servant, and to his supplication, O Lord my God, to hearken unto the cry and the prayer which thy servant prayeth before thee:

verses.text_plain: That thine eyes may be open upon this house day and night, upon the place whereof thou hast said that thou wouldest put thy name there; to hearken unto the prayer which thy servant prayeth toward this place.
verses.verse_html:
20That thine eyes may be open upon this house day and night, upon the place whereof thou hast said that thou wouldest put thy name there; to hearken unto the prayer which thy servant prayeth toward this place.
 toward: or, in this place

footnotes.body_html: toward: or, in this place

verses.text_plain: Hearken therefore unto the supplications of thy servant, and of thy people Israel, which they shall make toward this place: hear thou from thy dwelling place, even from heaven; and when thou hearest, forgive.
verses.verse_html:
21Hearken therefore unto the supplications of thy servant, and of thy people Israel, which they shall make toward this place: hear thou from thy dwelling place, even from heaven; and when thou hearest, forgive.
 make: Heb. pray
 ,
 toward: or, in this place

footnotes.body_html: make: Heb. pray
toward: or, in this place

verses.text_plain: If a man sin against his neighbour, and an oath be laid upon him to make him swear, and the oath come before thine altar in this house;
verses.verse_html:
22If a man sin against his neighbour, and an oath be laid upon him to make him swear, and the oath come before thine altar in this house;
 and an oath: Heb. and he require an oath of him

tokens.text: upon him to make him swear

footnotes.body_text: and an oath: Heb. and he require an oath of him
footnotes.body_html: and an oath: Heb. and he require an oath of him

verses.text_plain: Then hear thou from heaven, and do, and judge thy servants, by requiting the wicked, by recompensing his way upon his own head; and by justifying the righteous, by giving him according to his righteousness.
verses.verse_html: 23Then hear thou from heaven, and do, and judge thy servants, by requiting the wicked, by recompensing his way upon his own head; and by justifying the righteous, by giving him according to his righteousness.

verses.text_plain: And if thy people Israel be put to the worse before the enemy, because they have sinned against thee; and shall return and confess thy name, and pray and make supplication before thee in this house;
verses.verse_html:
24And if thy people Israel be put to the worse before the enemy, because they have sinned against thee; and shall return and confess thy name, and pray and make supplication before thee in this house;
 be put: or, be smitten
 ,
 in: or, toward

footnotes.body_html: be put: or, be smitten
in: or, toward

verses.text_plain: Then hear thou from the heavens, and forgive the sin of thy people Israel, and bring them again unto the land which thou gavest to them and to their fathers.
verses.verse_html: 25Then hear thou from the heavens, and forgive the sin of thy people Israel, and bring them again unto the land which thou gavest to them and to their fathers.

tokens.text: to them and to their fathers

verses.text_plain: When the heaven is shut up, and there is no rain, because they have sinned against thee; yet if they pray toward this place, and confess thy name, and turn from their sin, when thou dost afflict them;
verses.verse_html:
26When the heaven is shut up, and there is no rain, because they have sinned against thee; yet if they pray toward this place, and confess thy name, and turn from their sin, when thou dost afflict them;
 toward: or, in this place

footnotes.body_html: toward: or, in this place

verses.text_plain: Then hear thou from heaven, and forgive the sin of thy servants, and of thy people Israel, when thou hast taught them the good way, wherein they should walk; and send rain upon thy land, which thou hast given unto thy people for an inheritance.
verses.verse_html: 27Then hear thou from heaven, and forgive the sin of thy servants, and of thy people Israel, when thou hast taught them the good way, wherein they should walk; and send rain upon thy land, which thou hast given unto thy people for an inheritance.

verses.text_plain: If there be dearth in the land, if there be pestilence, if there be blasting, or mildew, locusts, or caterpillers; if their enemies besiege them in the cities of their land; whatsoever sore or whatsoever sickness there be:
verses.verse_html:
28If there be dearth in the land, if there be pestilence, if there be blasting, or mildew, locusts, or caterpillers; if their enemies besiege them in the cities of their land; whatsoever sore or whatsoever sickness there be:
 in the cities: Heb. in the land of their gates

footnotes.body_text: in the cities: Heb. in the land of their gates
footnotes.body_html: in the cities: Heb. in the land of their gates

verses.text_plain: Then what prayer or what supplication soever shall be made of any man, or of all thy people Israel, when every one shall know his own sore and his own grief, and shall spread forth his hands in this house:
verses.verse_html:
29Then what prayer or what supplication soever shall be made of any man, or of all thy people Israel, when every one shall know his own sore and his own grief, and shall spread forth his hands in this house:
 in: or, toward
 ,
 toward: or, in this place

tokens.text: soever shall be made of any man

footnotes.body_html: in: or, toward
toward: or, in this place

verses.text_plain: Then hear thou from heaven thy dwelling place, and forgive, and render unto every man according unto all his ways, whose heart thou knowest; (for thou only knowest the hearts of the children of men:)
verses.verse_html: 30Then hear thou from heaven thy dwelling place, and forgive, and render unto every man according unto all his ways, whose heart thou knowest; (for thou only knowest the hearts of the children of men:)

verses.text_plain: That they may fear thee, to walk in thy ways, so long as they live in the land which thou gavest unto our fathers.
verses.verse_html:
31That they may fear thee, to walk in thy ways, so long as they live in the land which thou gavest unto our fathers.
 so long: Heb. all the days which
 ,
 in the land: Heb. upon the face of the land

footnotes.body_text: so long: Heb. all the days which
footnotes.body_html: so long: Heb. all the days which

footnotes.body_text: in the land: Heb. upon the face of the land
footnotes.body_html: in the land: Heb. upon the face of the land

verses.text_plain: Moreover concerning the stranger, which is not of thy people Israel, but is come from a far country for thy great names sake, and thy mighty hand, and thy stretched out arm; if they come and pray in this house;
verses.verse_html:
32Moreover concerning the stranger, which is not of thy people Israel, but is come from a far country for thy great names sake, and thy mighty hand, and thy stretched out arm; if they come and pray in this house;
 toward: or, in this place

tokens.text: which is not of thy people

footnotes.body_html: toward: or, in this place

verses.text_plain: Then hear thou from the heavens, even from thy dwelling place, and do according to all that the stranger calleth to thee for; that all people of the earth may know thy name, and fear thee, as doth thy people Israel, and may know that this house which I have built is called by thy name.
verses.verse_html:
33Then hear thou from the heavens, even from thy dwelling place, and do according to all that the stranger calleth to thee for; that all people of the earth may know thy name, and fear thee, as doth thy people Israel, and may know that this house which I have built is called by thy name.
 this: Heb. thy name is called upon this house

tokens.text: according to all that the stranger
to thee for; that all people

footnotes.body_text: this: Heb. thy name is called upon this house
footnotes.body_html: this: Heb. thy name is called upon this house

verses.text_plain: If thy people go out to war against their enemies by the way that thou shalt send them, and they pray unto thee toward this city which thou hast chosen, and the house which I have built for thy name;
verses.verse_html: 34If thy people go out to war against their enemies by the way that thou shalt send them, and they pray unto thee toward this city which thou hast chosen, and the house which I have built for thy name;

verses.text_plain: Then hear thou from the heavens their prayer and their supplication, and maintain their cause.
verses.verse_html:
35Then hear thou from the heavens their prayer and their supplication, and maintain their cause.
 cause: or, right

footnotes.body_html: cause: or, right

verses.text_plain: If they sin against thee, (for there is no man which sinneth not,) and thou be angry with them, and deliver them over before their enemies, and they carry them away captives unto a land far off or near;
verses.verse_html:
36If they sin against thee, (for there is no man which sinneth not,) and thou be angry with them, and deliver them over before their enemies, and they carry them away captives unto a land far off or near;
 they carry them away captives: Heb. they that take them captives carry them away

footnotes.body_text: they carry them away captives: Heb. they that take them captives carry them away
footnotes.body_html: they carry them away captives: Heb. they that take them captives carry them away

verses.text_plain: Yet if they bethink themselves in the land whither they are carried captive, and turn and pray unto thee in the land of their captivity, saying, We have sinned, we have done amiss, and have dealt wickedly;
verses.verse_html:
37Yet if they bethink themselves in the land whither they are carried captive, and turn and pray unto thee in the land of their captivity, saying, We have sinned, we have done amiss, and have dealt wickedly;
 bethink: Heb. bring back to their heart

footnotes.body_text: bethink: Heb. bring back to their heart
footnotes.body_html: bethink: Heb. bring back to their heart

verses.text_plain: If they return to thee with all their heart and with all their soul in the land of their captivity, whither they have carried them captives, and pray toward their land, which thou gavest unto their fathers, and toward the city which thou hast chosen, and toward the house which I have built for thy name:
verses.verse_html: 38If they return to thee with all their heart and with all their soul in the land of their captivity, whither they have carried them captives, and pray toward their land, which thou gavest unto their fathers, and toward the city which thou hast chosen, and toward the house which I have built for thy name:

tokens.text: to thee with all their heart
whither they have carried them captives

verses.text_plain: Then hear thou from the heavens, even from thy dwelling place, their prayer and their supplications, and maintain their cause, and forgive thy people which have sinned against thee.
verses.verse_html:
39Then hear thou from the heavens, even from thy dwelling place, their prayer and their supplications, and maintain their cause, and forgive thy people which have sinned against thee.
 cause: or, right

footnotes.body_html: cause: or, right

verses.text_plain: Now, my God, let, I beseech thee, thine eyes be open, and let thine ears be attent unto the prayer that is made in this place.
verses.verse_html:
40Now, my God, let, I beseech thee, thine eyes be open, and let thine ears be attent unto the prayer that is made in this place.
 unto: Heb. to the prayer of this place

tokens.text: let, I beseech thee, thine eyes

footnotes.body_text: unto: Heb. to the prayer of this place
footnotes.body_html: unto: Heb. to the prayer of this place

verses.text_plain: Now therefore arise, O Lord God, into thy resting place, thou, and the ark of thy strength: let thy priests, O Lord God, be clothed with salvation, and let thy saints rejoice in goodness.
verses.verse_html: 41Now therefore arise, O Lord God, into thy resting place, thou, and the ark of thy strength: let thy priests, O Lord God, be clothed with salvation, and let thy saints rejoice in goodness.

verses.text_plain: O Lord God, turn not away the face of thine anointed: remember the mercies of David thy servant.
verses.verse_html: 42O Lord God, turn not away the face of thine anointed: remember the mercies of David thy servant.
